meanings.definition: A person or thing that is stared at in astonishment or awe.
meanings.sent1: The little girl in the sparkly costume was a real gapeseed at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The famous singer was a gapeseed as she walked down the red carpet.
meanings.sent3: The gapeseed puppy in the pet store was so adorable, everyone wanted to take him home.
meanings.sent4: The gapeseed sunset painted the sky in brilliant shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The gapeseed fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color and light.

meanings.definition: To stare with one's mouth open in wonder or amazement.
meanings.sent1: The children gapeseed at the magician as he pulled a rabbit out of his hat.
meanings.sent2: The audience gapeseed in awe as the acrobat performed daring stunts on the tightrope.
meanings.sent3: The tourists gapeseed at the towering skyscrapers in the city, amazed by their height.
meanings.sent4: She gapeseed at the intricate details of the painting, marveling at the artist's skill.
meanings.sent5: The students gapeseed at the erupting volcano during their science field trip, amazed by the power of nature.
